meanings.definition: To cause (a lens or optical system) to be out of focus.
meanings.sent1: She defocussed the camera to blur the background.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocussed the lens to create a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally defocussed the binoculars and couldn't see clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was defocussed on the task at hand, lost in daydreams.
meanings.sent5: The artist defocussed the painting to give it a soft, ethereal quality.

meanings.definition: To divert one's attention or focus away from something.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, she defocussed on her phone instead of the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He defocussed from the lecture and started daydreaming.
meanings.sent3: The cat defocussed the dog's attention by playing with a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind defocussed from the stress of work to focus on the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The magician defocussed the audience's attention with a sudden burst of confetti.
